reviewText: -----------------------------------------------------------------This is the third DVD of the SuperS series.  It has six episodes.The adventure continues with the Amazon trio trying again and again to track down and find the One (Pegasus), while at the same time being foiled again and again by Sailor Moon.This time however, there are a few twists and turns included:-Hawk's eye and Tiger's eye do a double team up on Mina,-Fish eye sees much more action than before,-and finally the Sailor Scouts power up to a much moresignificant level with the help of Pegasus.This DVD is definately worth watching and interesting as well.It gets a five star rating because at last the other Sailor Scouts powered up and now seem to play a signifant role other than just standing by and watching Sailor Moon fight.
summary: A review that may help you decide
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am a HUGE fan of Sailor Moon and I have to say that I was utterly disappointed when I got this. I received this, as well as Sailor Moon SuperS Pegasus Collections 1, 2, and 5 for Christmas of 2002.I had high expectations for the series at first, but those high expectations suddenly turned to low ones.This has to be the worst Sailor Moon season by far.It is completely boring and focuses mainly on Chibiusa and Pegasus.If you want to watch a good Sailor Moon season, watch either the first season (Sailor Moon) or the third (S).

reviewText: The cover, resversible cover, and the episodes on this disc are soooooo cute! Some people may think this season is dumb, but it's really good. Buy this dvd if you wanna see what happens after the first 12 episodes!

reviewText: I didn't really like the SS series, actually like the original the best (hope they eventually come out with an uncut version of it on dvd), but this has been an interesting series as opposed to watching it on CN.  In this one you get to see that fish-eye was actually a guy, and on the last episode of the disk, get to see the other scouts go super.  It was an ok disk, but mostly just got it for collection purposes.  Now if they would only release stars on to dvd.

reviewText: The first two episodes on this DVD contain some of the most hilarious comedy moments in all of Sailor Moon. The other episodes consist of some filler and some plot, none of it amazing. But all Sailor Moon is great ^^Through reading these reviews, I've discovered something quite interesting - there are actually people who watched the uncut dub of the first episode on this DVD and DIDN'T REALISE THAT FISH-EYE IS A MAN! A couple of reviews commented on how they were shocked at seeing "her" topless... when in fact it's pretty darn obvious that all you're seeing is a man without a shirt. Unless she's supposed to be the most flat-chested woman EVER.Of course, that episode makes no sense in the dub unless you believe that Fish-Eye is a woman. Maybe those reviewers are just playing along with Cloverway's stupidity?Anyway, the episodes on here are mostly good but nothing spectacular. The next DVD is where it gets GOOD (one of my favourite episodes of the entire series is on it - and incidentally, another episode on the next DVD DOES have nudity), but this is still worth getting.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Here's a review of the episodes, with synopsizes from WikiMoon.140.  Love Those Minis!  The Fashionable Senshi (Soldier):  Fisheye targets the fashion designer Yoshiki Usui, while Usagi hopes to persuade the designer to make her a wedding dress for free.  Please keep in mind my grade for this episode is for the English edited version.  A141.  Storm of Love!  Minako's Grand Two-timing Plan:  Usagi and the girls are shocked to find out that Minako is dating two boys at the same time, but little does anyone realize that her suitors are Tiger's Eye and Hawk's Eye.  One of the funniest episodes of the whole series.  A+142.  Mansion of Secrets!  Menu of Love To You:  The girls become interested in an apparently antisocial old woman after she takes Diana into her home.  A-143.  Time To Believe The Pegasus!  The Super Transformations of the Sailor Senshi:  Reports begin to flood in of a Pegasus wreaking havoc in the city. Meanwhile, a popular boy shows an interest in Chibiusa.  A144.  Sparkling Summer Days!  Ami, The Girl In the Ocean Breeze:  Shingo develops a crush on Ami during a trip to the beach, while Tiger's Eye plots to seduce her.  A145.  Aim For the Prima!  Usagi's Ballet:  Usagi begins ballet lessons in the hope of becoming a prima. Fisheye enrolls in the same class, and soon catches the eye of the instructor.  This is one Fish Eye episode I can watch in Japanese.  B+Since I don't have Volumes 4 & 5 I'll give you my opinion of them here.  Apart from the last episode of Volume 4 all the episodes on it were A/A+.  The last one was good, apart from the infamous naked Ami scene.  The series really starts to go wrong after the first Amazoness Quartet episode, with horrible filler episodes that lacked any charm at all.  The last 2 episodes on Volume 5 were watchable, but I am not willing to pay very much just to get them.  It does get much better for the last 2 volumes.  Though I must admit that's where it definitely gets worse than the manga, but that's another review to be discussed another time.
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you are looking for humorus Sailor Moon episodes, this is the DVD for you. Although the Japanese episodes are *much* better than the English. There are six episodes on this DVD.Love Those Minis! The Fasionable Soilders- What happens when Fish Eye targets a famous fasion designer, who promised to make Usagi's wedding dress?Storm of Love! Minako's Grand Two Timing Plan- My favorite out of all the episodes on this DVD. When Minako two times two boyfriends who turn out to be Hawks Eye, and Tigers Eye what will happen to the Senshi of Love?Mansion of Secrets! The Menu of Love to You- When a good deed is blown back into Marmoru's face, Diana rushes off to correct the mean old lady who did that. But Diana soon finds a loving friend, with a broken heart, not a mean old lady.Time to Beleive the Pegasus! The Super Transformations- Fish Eye is up to his usual trouble. When he targets a young boy who has a crush on Chibiusa, the Senshi have to act fast. But what happens when Sailor Moon, and Chibi Moon are trapped in the enemy's hand. The only way out of this is to trust the mysterious Pegasus.Sparkling Summer Days! Ami, the Girl in the Ocean Breeze- It is time to hit the beaches. The Senshi have decieded to take a day off, and enjoy the sun. But all of this is ruiend, when Ami becomes the target of the Amazon TrioAim for the Prima! Usagi's Ballet- Uhh ohh, Usagi has a new obession, ballet. Yet again, Fish Eye is causing trouble by targeting Usagi's ballet teacher. What is this, Usagi lands a part in a big ballet production?This DVD contains extreme humor. The music is of exellent quality. With the execption of the English theme song. In terms of the voices, the Japanese seiyuu is perfect, but I am a long list of things I hate about the English voice cast. I will spare you and not list them. Other than that, this DVD rocks, and is worth the money
